content.description: The pleasant sweeping arête to headwall climb is bolted friendly for easy lead purposes to get to the top of the wall. Great positions and fun moves. It's easy to make the crux up high harder than necessary.
content.protection: bolts to chains. (May want to place a large nut or mid size cam after 1st bolt on the RIGHT Start Variation.)
content.location: The left side of the outside corner/arête that delineates Hornets Nest slab from the Dihedral area.

content.description: A dynamic throw leads to a thought provoking slab.  Route was re-cleaned in 2011 and 2012.
content.protection: Bolts, Chain anchor on the face.
content.location: Located on the in the left center of the upper main wall.

content.description: A great climb up inside corner to the steeper right side headwall. It's hard to leave the bucket holds in the corner for the crimps and knobs on the right wall, but the fun bouldery moves thru the crux make many of us want it to continue for longer!
content.location: Start on the slab/inside corner right of chicken mcnubbins. Likely shares a couple moves with the dihedral route.

content.description: If you enjoy slab with minimal holds thru the crux (3rd-4th bolt area) this one's for you! Mostly a fun warm/dry climb in the off season. Easy to TR a direct line (5.10+); and provides a good anchor for the gear route Drag Queen (5.8).
content.location: Right-most climb possible at the upper main wall.

content.description: Starts off with a fun ceiling in the bottom that is juggy vertical fun, then it's nothing but dirty friction nubbins for the rest of the route.  This route can be TR if you don't feel comfortable on the slab.
content.protection: Protect the ceiling down low with a cam, then 3 bolts with chains at the top.
content.location: Just to the right of the dirty sloped diehedral on the upper section of the main wall.
